864497887:
[

Team Leader Planning

Company Name Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre Company Location 1 Convention Centre Place , South Wharf, VIC 3006, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 50 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Planning Leadership Team
  • Full time permanent role
  • Employer of Choice 2018 recipient


We have a fantastic opportunity for a Team Leader to join our Planning team. Our Team Leader is responsible for assisting the Senior Manager Planning by overseeing and managing the day to day operations of the Planning Team ensuring they deliver an outstanding experience for our customers' events. The Team Leader directs and supports an experienced team of Event Planners to ensure our customer’s requirements are understood and executed in an efficient and effective manner.

The position


As our Team Leader you will....

  • Direct, coach and mentor Planning team members to successfully deliver to the MCEC standards and customer expectations
  • Engage in regular one on ones and performance reviews with team members encouraging an open and constructive working environment
  • Develop and implement event plans and processes
  • Liaise closely with external stakeholders, particularly customers
  • Foster and maintain positive relationships with internal stakeholders critical to the smooth delivery of events
  • Manage and action customer feedback
  • Manage a portfolio of events, planning to a standard that ensures the customers’ needs are exceeded
  • Support the Senior Manager, Planning to ensure customer review target scores are achieved and contributions to organisational revenue budgets met

You


To be considered for our Team Leader role, you must be able to demonstrate...

  • A minimum of 5 years’ experience leading and developing an Event Planning team to achieve operational success
  • Significant experience in event management - particularly in high volume, large scale events
  • Strong focus on developing customer solutions with both internal and external customers
  • Ability to apply a helicopter view to events and employ foresight to deliver solutions
  • Excellent communication skills - verbal, written and presenting
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively and autonomously


Why MCEC?


At MCEC, you can expect anything and experience everything, because just like every event, every day at MCEC is different. You’ll be encouraged to reach your potential and learn how you can grow as a leader, no matter what role you’re in. You’ll achieve this by working with some of the best people in our industry. Were committed to helping you take your role as far as possible, and will invest in your personal development through a broad range of experiences and learning and development opportunities throughout your time with us.\xa0


Working with us, you’ll also enjoy a range of benefits including an onsite restaurant and free parking.


Join us to challenge your thoughts, embrace the opportunity to drive your career and to be part of something extraordinary.


Please include a cover letter and CV with your application. Applications must be submitted online. \xa0Applications will be reviewed as they come in and suitable candidates contacted for an interview, so don’t hesitate to apply!\xa0Applications to be submitted online, not by email.

At this stage only applicants with valid working rights in Australia are encouraged to apply!

Change Manager

Company Name MetaPM Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 99 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

MetaPM is looking for multiple,\xa0\xa0immediately avaliable, career oriented and passionate Change Managers\xa0 who will participate in the journey of business transformation. You will bring your knowledge of PROSCI/ ADKAR methodologies to assist with organisational change projects.\xa0


You must have:

  • A minimum of 3 years Change/ Organisation Development experience\xa0
  • Experience in design and delivery of change initiatives such as training, communication, change network enablement, behavioural change plans and adoption measurements
  • The ability to articulate the case for change within any organisation
  • Experience within Telecommunications/ Utilities/ Government / Higher Education highly regarded
  • Immediate availability
  • Eastern/ Western suburbs & CBD locations\xa0


Personal Attributes

  • Outstanding interpersonal and relationship building skills evidenced in managing expectations of executive and senior business stakeholders
  • Ability to engage business stakeholders at various levels
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills


Technical Skills

  • Proven experience using PROSCI/ ADKAR Methodologies
  • Experience with organistional change- people, not systems
  • Demonstrated understanding of Project Management approaches
  • Effective use of change tools, such as change impact assessments, change risk analyses and readiness assessments to guide prioritization of change interventions.

Ideally we would also like to see:

  • A curiosity and a natural flair for innovation, showing a balance in your ability to contribute new ideas, whilst still learning from the best
  • Friendly, honest, motivated, assertive and not afraid to ask questions!
  • A high level of integrity
  • A sense of humour, even when under pressure

.NET / Sitecore Technical Consultant

Company Name Bluefin Resources Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 15 hours ago Number of views 7 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

A growing consultancy is working with several high profile Melbourne based businesses undertaking major transformational activities. They are currently overhauling a range of internal collaboration services and undertaking a migration from its legacy Content Management Solution to a brand new solution built on Sitecore with a global giant, headquartered locally.

In support of these projects, they are seeking to identify a talented .NET Developer and Technical Consultant with Sitecore knowledge to play a key ongoing role within the group. Working in a team of technology experts, this role will see the successful candidates tasked with delivering new capabilities to the organisation through a CMS upgrade within a highly visible businesses environment.

Additionally You Will
  • Demonstrate your capabilities as a Sitecore Subject Matter Expert and Lead Developer in .NET technologies
  • Coupled with experience with modern JS Frameworks
  • Demonstrated experience with CI/CD processes and solutions
  • Work collaboratively with stakeholders to stand up customer facing products and design elegant, user-focussed solutions.
  • Establish and maintain best practice development standards and take responsibility for mentoring junior develops and managing external vendor relationships.
  • Work independently, providing accurate progress reporting to senior management.


To be successful in this position you will have advanced knowledge of front-end development and configuration and a talent for C#/.NET. You will also demonstrate expert knowledge of Sitecore. Outstanding communication and abilities and client facing experience is a must, as well as a passion for working with emerging technologies and enthusiastic approach to motivating and engaging within a tight-knit team.

For more information, contact Adam Higgs and Bluefin Resources on 03 8330 5001 or click the apply button.

APS6 Legal & Policy Officer

Company Name Administrative Appeals Tribunal Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 143 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 APS6 Legal & Policy Officer
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0$77,950 to $89,275 plus 15.4% superannuation
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Temporary role with possibility of becoming permanent
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0May be located in Sydney or Melbourne
\xa0
Legal & Policy Officers work as part of a team delivering a range of legal, policy and other services for the AAT, including participating in practice and procedure projects.

The Legal and Policy section is responsible for providing advice to the Tribunal’s senior leaders on a diverse range of legal and policy issues, developing and maintaining practice and procedure documents, legal instruments and public information products, monitoring appeals and litigation to which the Tribunal is a party and compliance with the legal and regulatory requirements of the Tribunal, including responding to freedom of information and privacy requests.

Our ideal candidate will have legal qualifications, possess well-developed communication, legal research, analytical and problem solving skills. They will have the ability to apply legislation, well developed organisational skills and work well within a small, busy team. Experience in handling freedom of information and privacy matters is desirable.

More information about this position, the scope of the role, duties and selection criteria, is contained within the position description for this role, available from the Working at the AAT page of our website, www.aat.gov.au.
\xa0
Notes:
You must possess tertiary qualifications in law. Admission as an Australian lawyer in an Australian state or territory is desirable.

A non-ongoing opportunity will be offered for a specific term of up to 12 months, with a possibility of either extension or the engagement
being made ongoing.

An order of merit established through this selection process may be used to fill this or future similar vacancies on an ongoing or non-ongoing basis.

Contact Officer:
Any questions about this position should be directed to Sonia Pawliw on 02 9276 5187 or at sonia.pawliw@aat.gov.au.

How to apply for this position:
Applications must be lodged online through our web based e-recruitment system. To lodge your application, find the advertisement for this position by following the link on the Working at the AAT page and click “Apply Now”.
\xa0
Applications must include a statement addressing the selection criteria. Responses to each selection criterion should be limited to 400 words. Your application, including your statement of claims and your resume, should not exceed eight pages.
\xa0
Applications will be accepted until 11:30 pm on 23 September 2018.

Please contact our recruitment team on (02) 9276 5547 or recruitment@aat.gov.au should you require assistance with accessing our website or with lodging your application.

More information about this position, the scope of the role, duties and selection criteria, is contained within the position description for this role, available from the Working at the AAT page of our website, www.aat.gov.au.

857776214:
[

Lead Test Analyst

Company Name ahm Health Insurance Company Location Docklands, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 477 views

Job description

We're passionate about nurturing careers.

\xa0

We support new innovation and thinking, and openly collaborate and share new ideas. We're healthy and active in our lives and wellbeing is encouraged at every level. Our people play an important role in the future of health and healthcare and we believe that working together, we're stronger.

\xa0

About Us

\xa0

ahm is committed to making health insurance more affordable and accessible for more Australians. With hundreds of thousands of members, we offer a simple range of hospital and flexible extras products. Based in Melbourne with a service centre located in Wollongong, ahm has been backed by Australia’s leading private health insurer Medibank Private Limited since 2009.

\xa0

The Opportunity

\xa0

Working directly with the testing team and digital delivery squads you will be providing technical expertise in all areas of product development, implementation and testing. This is a full-time fixed term opportunity for 12 months.

\xa0

As the Lead Test Analyst, you will be responsible for implementing automated tests for components of all digital deliveries including the online system and play an active role in conducting static testing.

\xa0

Key responsibilities will include:

\xa0

  • Develop system test strategy for manual and automation testing and drive quality.
  • Perform automated and manual regression testing and exploratory testing.
  • Enhance/update automation scripts wherever required using current automation framework (Cypress for web and Appium for mobile).
  • Develop and execute tests for products and related components.
  • Facilitate or contribute to root cause analysis, investigations, troubleshooting and resolving issues.
  • Participate in collaborative design reviews and perform test code inspections leading to optimizations.

About You

\xa0

To be successful in this role, you will have a real holistic view of testing and be a mentor to our Test Analysts and provide guidance and input for testing methodologies. You will also be able to build collaborative relationships within the team and across the business.

\xa0

Other skills and experience include:

\xa0

  • Minimum 3 years of automation testing experience;
  • Experience working within an agile environment utilising BDD for 6+ months;
  • Experience in Appium frameworks, Selenium and Cypress.io;
  • Experience with Jira and/or other project management tools
  • Experience working on various SIT projects and an understanding of modern web APIs;
  • Understating of test levels, test types and varied advanced test techniques;
  • Experience with Continuous Integration (CI) tools/platforms;
  • Javascript programming experience is a bonus;
  • Experience with CQS would be highly desirable.

\xa0

What We Offer

\xa0

In return for your hard work we offer a great remuneration package and a range of fantastic benefits. Furthermore, we take the health and wellbeing of our employees seriously, offering flexible working conditions and encouraging wellbeing at all levels of life.


ahm is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.


A Career at ahm adds up to more. More achievement. More progress. More passion and more innovation for health. For a career option that will suit you better, click to apply.


For a confidential discussion, please email Denika.Mitkov@medibank.com.au

865088989:
[

Remote Maritime Doctors

Company Name Aspen Medical Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 16 hours ago Number of views 7 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Description

Aspen Medical is seeking Expressions of Interest (EOI) from Remote Maritime Doctors to provide clinical services to the Australian Border and Protection Service.

Aspen Medical has been engaged by the ACBPS to provide medical support on board a number of Australian Customs Vessels for missions which generally operate for approximately 28 days. This is not your standard Medical Officer role and as such we are seeking candidates who are looking for something a little different.

We are seeking a Medical Practitioner with a broad range of skills who can operate in very remote and sometimes difficult conditions. As the Remote Maritime Doctor you will be required to manage a broad range of contingencies without the support of an on board medical team. You will use your broad range of medical training and experience to respond to and treat all types of medical emergencies and issues which may arise during the voyage. This role offers the opportunity to showcase your adaptability and experience across a range of potential medical situations.

Perhaps you are seeking to expand your professional experience; seeking exposure to a different and exciting role; or just a change in your working environment for a short period of time. Whatever your motivation, we welcome a confidential conversation with you.

Experience, Qualifications And Documentation Required

In addition to being able to meet Aspen Medical's credentialing requirements, you will need to hold (or be eligible to gain) a current Baseline Security Clearance and an Employment Suitability Clearance. In order to be eligible for these clearances you must be an Australian Citizen. A current Early Management of Severe Trauma (EMST) certification is also a must for this role.

Contact Information

Misty Horne

Industry

  • Hospital & Health Care

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Health Care Provider
]
